description: From Middle English unholi, unhaliȝ, from Old English unhāliġ, from Proto-Germanic *unhailagaz, equivalent to un- +‎ holy. Cognate with Scots unhaly, Dutch onheilig, German Low German unhillig, German unheilig, Danish uhellig, Swedish ohelig.

adjectives.description: unholy (comparative unholier or more unholy, superlative unholiest or most unholy)

entries.meaning: Not holy; (by extension) evil, impure, or otherwise perverted.
examples: The priest's unholy behaviour brought the church into disrepute.

entries.meaning: Dreadful, terrible, excessive, or otherwise atrocious.
examples: What an unholy mess your room is in!
I've been spending an unholy amount of time trying to write a novel!
